title: Mainly fair weather to prevail today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Galle, Matara, Kaluthara and Rathnapura districts in the evening or night today (21).

title: Gold price hits record high in global market
byline: The spot gold price is trading at record highs and targets the psychological $3000 mark amid flight-to-safety inflows due to growing uncertainties regarding the Ukraine-Russia war and US President Trump’s tariff threats.

title: “Maldives draw valuable lessons from Sri Lanka’s economic recovery”: Maldives FM
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met with the visiting Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Maldives, Abdulla Khaleel at the Presidential Secretariat on Thursday (20).

title: Govt. to implement urgent actions to prevent elephant–train collisions
byline: A special discussion was held at the Parliament premises yesterday (20) to address the pressing issue of wild elephants being hit by trains, following the tragic accident that claimed the lives of six elephants near the 141st mile post between Galoya and Hingurakgoda railway stations.

title: SLFP to contest upcoming elections under ‘chair’ symbol
byline: The Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) has decided to contest the upcoming elections under the “chair” symbol.

title: ‘OnmaxDT’ database operator arrested in Dubai and brought to Sri Lanka
byline: An individual named Gayan Wickramathilake, who allegedly maintained the ‘OnmaxDT’ database, has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in Dubai for the alleged fraudulent pyramid scheme.

title: 200 fraud suspects repatriated from Myanmar to China
byline: A chartered flight repatriating the first batch of Chinese nationals totaling 200 suspected of being involved in fraud crimes from Myanmar landed in Nanjing, East China’s Jiangsu Province, via Thailand on Thursday afternoon.

title: Ven. Dr. Gallelle Sumanasiri Thero resigns as Rajarata Uni. Chancellor
byline: Ven. Dr. Gallelle Sumanasiri Thero, who was appointed as Chancellor of the Rajarata University on 10 February, has tendered his resignation from the position.

title: Argentine court drops charges against 3 people tied to death of singer Liam Payne
byline: A court in Argentina dropped charges of criminal negligence against three of the five people indicted in connection with the death of Liam Payne, the former One Direction singer who fell from a third-floor hotel balcony in Buenos Aires last October, according to a ruling obtained by The Associated Press on Thursday.

title: Apple unveils a souped-up and more expensive version of its lowest priced iPhone
byline: Apple has released a sleeker and more expensive version of its lowest priced iPhone in an attempt to widen the audience for a bundle of artificial intelligence technology that the company has been hoping will revive demand for its most profitable product lineup.

title: Three including cop arrested over Middeniya shooting
byline: Police have arrested three suspects including a police constable in connection with the Middeniya shooting incident which killed three persons including a father and his two children on Tuesday night (18).

title: Sri Lanka’s first “Water Battery”: CEB advances Maha Oya Pumped Storage hydropower project
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) says that it is making significant progress toward launching the Maha Oya Pumped Storage Hydropower Project, Sri Lanka’s first-ever “Water Battery.”

title: India and Sri Lanka strengthen ties in critical minerals, exploration, and mining
byline: India and Sri Lanka on Saturday held a meeting to strengthen ties between both the countries in the areas of critical minerals, exploration, and mining.

title: 29-year-old found shot dead at beach in Pamunugama
byline: A 29-year-old youth has been found shot dead by an unidentified gunman at the Morganwatta Beach in Pamunugama, Ja-Ela.

title: Speaker tables report on MP Ramanathan Archchuna’s conduct
byline: The Speaker of the Parliament Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne announced to the House that the report of the committee appointed to investigate the conduct of Jaffna District MP Ramanathan Archchuna will be tabled.

title: Govt’s objective is to position Sri Lanka as competitive nation on global stage – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that the government’s aspiration is to elevate Sri Lanka, currently not a competitor in the field of innovation, to a comparable status with other countries, emphasizing that digitalization will play a crucial role in achieving this objective.

title: Sri Lankans among migrants deported from US to Panama, moved to jungle region
byline: A group of nearly 100 migrants deported from the U.S. to Panama last week, including Sri Lankans has been moved from a hotel in the capital to the Darien jungle region in the south of the country, Panama’s government said on Wednesday.

title: Kash Patel confirmed to head FBI despite fear he will persecute Trump adversaries
byline: The Senate on Thursday narrowly voted to confirm Kash Patel as director of the FBI, moving to place him atop the nation’s premier federal law enforcement agency despite doubts from Democrats about his qualifications and concerns he will do Donald Trump’s bidding and go after the Republican president’s adversaries.

title: Overseas travel ban imposed on individual accused of promoting pyramid scheme
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has imposed an overseas travel ban on an individual allegedly involved in promoting a pyramid investment scheme in Sri Lanka, which is operated from abroad.

title: Sri Lanka becomes signatory of UN agreement on bio-diversity
byline: Sri Lanka has become a signatory to the agreement under the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea on the Conservation and Sustainable use of Marine Biological Diversity of Areas beyond National Jurisdiction (BBNJ) at the United Nations headquarters in New York.

title: Sri Lanka’s inflation dips to -4.0% in January 2025
byline: The overall rate of inflation as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI) on Y-o-Y basis decreased to -4.0% in January 2025, compared to -2.0% in December 2024, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Suspect who maintained ‘OnmaxDT’ database remanded
byline: Gayan Wickramathilake, the individual allegedly responsible for maintaining the ‘OnmaxDT’ database, has been remanded until March 7 after being produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (21).

title: More details revealed on policeman arrested over Middeniya triple murder
byline: Middeniya Police are conducting further investigations into a triple murder that occurred in the Middeniya Police Division on February 18, in which a father and his two children were killed following a shooting incident.

title: Amazon takes creative control of James Bond franchise
byline: In a shocking update for all James Bond fans, Amazon MGM Studios is set to take creative control of the James Bond franchise.

title: Policeman arrested in connection with ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder remanded
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court has ordered to remand until March 07, the police officer arrested in connection with the investigations into the murder of notorious underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararathne, alias “Ganemulla Sanjeewa”.

title: Warm weather advisory issued for several provinces, districts
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a Warm weather Advisory for tomorrow in several provinces and districts in the country.

title: Vietnam ready to share agri, tourism, and investment promotion expertise with Sri Lanka
byline: A meeting between the Secretary to the President, Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake and the Vietnamese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Ms. Trinh Thi Tam, took place this morning (21) at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo.

title: Girlfriend of Ganemulla Sanjeewa’s killer arrested
byline: Maharagama Police have arrested a woman believed to be the girlfriend of the shooter who carried out the assassination of notorious underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararathne, alias “Ganemulla Sanjeewa.”

title: One person killed in Kotahena shooting; Suspects arrested
byline: An individual was shot and killed by a gunman who had arrived on a motorcycle with another accomplice at Galpoththa Junction in Kotahena this evening (21), police said.
